recommendations: Pratyush Rai ‚ÄúAbhishek is a standout go-getter. I had the pleasure to work with him as the first-ever Chief Secretary of President of Students' Gymkhana. In simple terms, he managed shops (ex: fulfilled 6+ major longstanding promises on new shops), important infrastructure committees (ex: worked very closely with Dean of Infra & Planning), organized key student events (ex: successfully managed a safe treasure hunt for freshers amid various anti-ragging regulations). He also led a team of 20+ individuals at different times to execute important matters of the Presidents' Office. Best thing I observed about him: Once you can inspire him to focus on something, he puts his heart & soul into it (goes "all-in" at a different level). He takes extreme ownership, thrives in doing work independently (at times to a fault), & is very purpose-driven. He is also very lively outside work. He is definitely going to be an ultimate asset on any purpose-driven team. I highly recommend Abhishek if you need to get the job done!‚Äù
publications: [{"title":"Making Sense of COVID-19 and its Spread","subtitle":"The Geopolitics","date":"May 20, 2020"},{"title":"Widening gap between Supply & Demand in Labor Market","subtitle":"Qrius (The Indian Economist)","date":"May 1, 2020"},{"title":"Rise of Neoliberalism & Can India replicate the success story of China?","subtitle":"Qrius (The Indian Economist)","date":"April 15, 2020","description":"In this article I have talked about the expectations of Neoliberal Economists and its effects, I have also attempted to answer the long standing question that \"Can India sustain its Economic Growth?\"."},{"title":"Mahalanobis Model to Harrod-Domar Model: Story of Economic Disparity","subtitle":"Qrius (The Indian Economist)","date":"April 8, 2020","description":"Presented the economic disparity in the society, and talks about the changing agendas of the Govt. across the seven decades of Independent India, and its impact on people across the economic pyramid."},{"title":"Socialist India from the perspective of Poor","subtitle":"Qrius (The Indian Economist)","date":"April 1, 2020"}]
